JavaScript_Quiz.question: What does HTML stand for?
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language.

JavaScript_Quiz.question: What is the correct HTML element for the largest heading?
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: The <h1> tag is the first header tag visible on a page and is usually used for the title of a page or post, hence it having the largest size of all headings.

JavaScript_Quiz.question:
The correct HTML element for inserting a line break is
.
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation::
The
element will insert a single line break.

JavaScript_Quiz.question: Which HTML tag will create an ordered list, where each list item is numbered?
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: An ordered list will start with the <ol> tag, where each list item will have a number.

JavaScript_Quiz.question: Which HTML tag will create an unordered list, where each list item has a bullet point?
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: An unordered list starts with the <ul> tag, where each list item will have a bullet point in front of it.

JavaScript_Quiz.question:
The

element defines the document body.
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: The <body> element defines the document body.

JavaScript_Quiz.question:
The

element defines a paragraph.
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation::
The

element defines a paragraph.

JavaScript_Quiz.question: What HTML tag defines a hyperlink and allows you to create links in your page?
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: Anchor tags define a hyperlink and allow you to create a link within your webpage.

JavaScript_Quiz.question: ____ are used at the beginning and end of an element.
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: HTML elements are represented by tags which are given to elements at their beginning and end.

JavaScript_Quiz.question: ____ are given to elements within a tag for the purpose of defining a property.
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: Attributes are assigned to elements to provide additional information about an element.

JavaScript_Quiz.question: Whatever is in between the <html> tags is the content of a web page.
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: The <html> tag tells the browser that this is an HTML document, therefore anything in between the tags is considered the content of a web page.

JavaScript_Quiz.question: An <iframe> is used to display a web page within a web page.
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: The <iframe> tag allows for the display of a web page within a web page.

JavaScript_Quiz.question: What tag defines a division or section in an HTML document?
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: The <div> tag defines a division in an HTML document.

JavaScript_Quiz.question: Which tag  defines a standard cell in an HTML table?
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: The <td> tag stands for table data and corresponds to a single cell in a HTML table.

JavaScript_Quiz.question: Which HTML attribute specifies an alternate text for an image, if the image canâ€™t be displayed?
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: The alt attribute specifies an alternate text for an image, if the image cannot be displayed.

JavaScript_Quiz.question: The <b> tag specifies bold text.
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: The <b> tag will make text bold when used.

JavaScript_Quiz.question: The Hex color code #000000 corresponds to which color?
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: The Hex color code #000000 corresponds to the color black.

JavaScript_Quiz.question: The Hex color code #FFFFFF corresponds to which of the following colors?
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: The Hex color code #000000 corresponds to the color black.

JavaScript_Quiz.question: The ____ tag is used to group inline-elements in a document.
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: The <span> tag will group together inline-elements in a document.

JavaScript_Quiz.question: The <link> tag defines a set of navigation links.
JavaScript_Quiz.explanation:: The <nav> tag defines a set of navigation links.
